intro: Operculina leptoptera, commonly known as the slender operculum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Operculina leptoptera is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
